title: Hitmen keep trying to hire more hitmen for botched murder of estate agent
text:

A group of hitmen who repeatedly kept trying to subcontract a murder to each other have been jailed.

Tan Youhui first offered Xi Guangan two million yuan (£220,000) to "take out" his business rival Wei Miu.

A court heard Guangan took the cash but hired a second hitman, Mo Tianxiang, for the job.

He paid the crook one million yuan (£110,000) and pocketed the rest.

But Tianxiang sought the services of Yang Kangsheng for the murder in Guangxi, China. He paid him 270,000 yuan (£30,000) up front and an additional 500,000 yuan (£55,000) when the deed was done.

Yet, Kangsheng offered Yang Guasheng 200,000 yuan (£22,000) up front and then a further 500,000 yuan (£55,000) after the job was complete.

(Image: Universal Images Group)

However, the fourth hitman hired the fifth - and final - hitman, Ling Xiansi, who agreed to do the job for 100,000 yuan (£11,000), a court was told.

Xiansi met with estate agent Wei Miu in Guangxi but, instead of going through with the murder, told him about the plot and the outsourcing.

And Xiansi faked the businessman's death by gagging him and sending photos to Guasheng, his hitman boss.

The pictures eventually reached the original client, Youhui, in 2013 and all involved considered the murder was done.

But police were notified at some stage and investigated the plot.

And on Tuesday, Tan was sentenced to five years in prison, the five hitmen were sentenced to between two and four years in jail.

They were each convicted of attempted murder after a lengthy trial.
description: Tan Youhui wanted his business competitor Wei Miu dead in Guangxi, China, but the sinister murder plot sensationally backfired
